*The route by which the ordered item is to be administered into the subject's body.(en)
*Details of the medical device used to assist delivery of the ordered item.(en)

*For example: 'To reduce your blood pressure', 'To thin your blood'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible. If required it is possible to use a LINK attribute to associate this element with, for example, the 'original diagnosis' in a separate Problem list composition but the indication should be explicitly recorded here, as the link target may change over time.(en)
*An additional instruction directed primarily at the individual/patient or carers.(en)
*Example: Detailed instructions for phased dispensing of opiates.(en)
*An additional instruction directed primarily at the person dispensing the ordered item.(en)
*For example: 'Please check renal function in 2 weeks'. This data element allows multiple occurrences.(en)
*An additional instruction which gives advice on recommended or required monitoring of the ordered item.(en)

*Course summary may be required when transmitting nutrition information between systems or representing a FHIR Nutrition statement. For example: as part of a referral, emergency patient summary or discharge communication.(en)
*Summary information about use of the ordered item, such as current status or key dates, generally used in non-prescription contexts.(en)
*Directions about the dispensing of the ordered item.(en)
*The maximum, cumulative amount of nutrition which should be administered within the allowed period. The unit for this amount is carried in Maximum amount unit.(en)

*In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)
*Permission for substitution with a bioequivalent item.(en)

*For example 'Urgent'. This is left to be templated or specialised according to local valuesets. Some jurisdictions allow instructions to dispense to be marked as 'urgent' so that the dispensary handles them quickly.(en)
*An indicator of the urgency with which the ordered item should be dispensed.(en)
*Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the ordered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)
*Structured details about the overall preparation including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)
*For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*The unit for the maximum amount allowed.(en)
*The overall therapeutic intent of the ordered item.(en)

*The total daily dose records the expected effective dose, and thus support titration of an initial low dose towards the effective dose over a period of time. This is not itself the target dose or goal but the actual effective daily dose against that goal. In some circumstances the Total daily dose will be calcuable from computable directions, in others it may need to be manually entered.(en)
*Details about the total daily amount of the ordered item expected to be administered.(en)
*The amount of ordered item which will be taken each day if administered as intended.(en)
*The dose units are normally scientific units such as mg, ml rather than 'tablets'.(en)
*The dose unit associated with the total daily amount.(en)
*The reason why an ordered item should not be substituted at dispense.(en)
*May be used to control the time of dispensing of nutritions with potential for abuse. For example: benzodiazepines or analgesics.(en)
*The date from which the ordered item is permitted to be dispensed for the first time.(en)
*In some jurisdictions, orders to dispense may have an expiry date after which the prescription may not be dispensed.(en)
*The date after which the ordered item is no longer valid to be legally dispensed.(en)
*For example: 'Not responsive at maximum recommended dose. Critical situation.', 'Peniciilin is only valid treatment, likelihood of true penicillin allergy is low'.(en)
*The reason for a clinical safety or maximum dose override.(en)

*For example: 'Hypertension control', 'Target dose 20mg daily'. The description could be used to identify a name, phrase or paragraph about the purpose for recording total daily effective dose, commonly to allow to titration towards a specific target dose. The goal or target dose might be recorded here or more commonly as part of a linked EVALUATION 'Goal' archetype.(en)
*Description of the reason for recording a total daily effective dose.(en)
*Additional structured details about the ordered item not captured in other fields.(en)
*Additional narrative about the nutrition order not captured in other fields.(en)
*Substitution of the nutrition with a bioequivalent nutrition is allowed.(en)
*Substitution of the nutrition with a bioequivalent nutrition is not allowed.(en)
*This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding nutrition dispensing.(en)

*A known or recognised safety issue which applies to this subject and the ordered item, such as an allergy, drug duplication warning or contraindication. This element is normally only recorded when this safety advice is overridden.(en)

*In some settings, it is common to split overall narrative directions into more specific segments of narrative. For example in hospital settings, it can be common to split the overall directions into 'Dose amount' and 'Dose timing', both as narrative text. These terms can be applied at template or run-time.(en)
*A narrative description of a specific part of overall directions.(en)
Razlog za ne upotevanje predloga prirejanja
*A description of the justification used to calculate a dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor.(en)
*Details of structured dose and timing directions.(en)

For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.
The combination of a medication amount and a single medication timing.

For example: 'for 7 days','Indefinite'. An example of a set of multiple directions, with varying durations might be ... '1 tablet daily for 3 days, 2 tablets daily for 4 days, then 3 tablets Indefinite'.
The length of time for which this direction should be applied.
The direction should be continued indefinitely.
The direction should be continued indefinitely with a strong recommendation that it never be discontinued.
For example: 'every 3 days', 'on Thursdays and Sundays', '3 days after onset of menstruation'.
Structured details about pattern of repetition for each set of daily directions.
For example, conditional instructions such as insulin /glucose infusion rates dependent on blood glucose, or detailed administration instructions for particular preparations.
Further details about an ordered item direction.
Example: 'Give once only' = 1 or '400mg 12hrly for 3 doses' = 3.
The maximum number of administrations to be given for this direction.

*For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.(en)
*The combination of a medication amount and a single medication timing.(en)

*For example: 'for 7 days','Indefinite'. An example of a set of multiple directions, with varying durations might be ... '1 tablet daily for 3 days, 2 tablets daily for 4 days, then 3 tablets Indefinite'.(en)
*The length of time for which this direction should be applied.(en)
*The direction should be continued indefinitely with a strong recommendation that it never be discontinued.(en)
*For example: 'every 3 days', 'on Thursdays and Sundays', '3 days after onset of menstruation'.(en)
*Structured details about pattern of repetition for each set of daily directions.(en)
*For example, conditional instructions such as insulin /glucose infusion rates dependent on blood glucose, or detailed administration instructions for particular preparations.(en)
*Further details about an ordered item direction.(en)
*The maximum number of administrations to be given for this direction.(en)
Structured information about the timing (intended or actual) of administration or use of a medicine, other therapeutic good or other intervention that is given on a scheduled basis.
e.g. "4 times per day" or ""3 to 4 times per hour"
The frequency as number of times per time period (limited to a single day) that the activity is to take place.
A specific time or interval of time during a single day when the activity should occur.
The time interval or minimum and maximum range of an interval between each scheduled activity, limited to a single day.
Is exact timing of the activity critical to patient safety or wellbeing?
The activity should only occur when the "as required" trigger condition is met.
The condition which triggers an 'as required' activity.
e.g. before each meal, at bedtime, in the morning. It is understood that these terms may not equate to the same exact times in different cultures.
A specific, named time event within a single day, when the activity should occur.
Perform the activity in the morning.
Perform the activity in the morning and at night.
in the morning and at night
*Structured information about the timing (intended or actual) of administration or use of a medicine, other therapeutic good or other intervention that is given on a scheduled basis.(en)
*e.g. "4 times per day" or ""3 to 4 times per hour"(en)
*The frequency as number of times per time period (limited to a single day) that the activity is to take place.(en)
*A specific time during a single day when the activity should occur.(en)
*The time interval between each scheduled activity, limited to a single day.(en)
*Is exact timing of the activity critical to patient safety or wellbeing?(en)
*The activity should only occur when the "as required" trigger condition is met.(en)
*The condition which triggers an 'as required' activity.(en)
*e.g. before each meal, at bedtime, in the morning. It is understood that these terms may not equate to the same exact times in different cultures.(en)
*A specific, named time event within a single day, when the activity should occur.(en)
*Perform the activity in the morning and at night.(en)
Tip kuhinje iz katere prihaja dodatek k obroku
Dodatn einformacije o dodatku k obroku

For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.
The combination of a medication amount and administration timing for a single day, in the context of a medication order or medication management.
Structured details about the timing pattern for a single day.
The period of time over which a single dose of the medication or vaccine should be administered.
For example: '200 ml/h'. Use the text data type to record non- or semi-quantifiable instructions.
The rate at which the medication, such as an infusion, is to be administered.

For example: '10mg/kg/day'. The result of this formula would normally be held in Dose amount/unit or Administration rate/duration. Where clinical measurements such as body weight is used in the dose calculation, a LINK attribute should used to specify which particular measurement has been used.
The formula used to calculate the dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor, such as body weight or surface area.
The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.
For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
The unit which is associated with the Dose amount.

For example: '1', '2', '3'. Where multiple dosages are expressed, the 'Pattern sequence' makes the order in which they should be executed explicit. For example: (1) 1 tab in the morning, (2) 2 tab at 2pm, (3) 1 tab at night.
The intended position of this dosage within the overall sequence of dosages.

For example, can be used to represent a unit-dose based value such as 'tabs', when the Dose amount is expressed as an SI unit such as 'mg', or where it is required to express the total amount of an infusion as well as the dose amount of the active ingredient.
An alternate representation of the value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.
The unit which is associated with the Alternate dose amount.

For example: "Apply ointment to affected area until it glistens". This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for increasing/tapering dosages without necessarily specifying the doses in a structured way.

*For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.(en)
*The combination of a medication amount and administration timing for a single day, in the context of a medication order or medication management.(en)
*Structured details about the timing pattern for a single day.(en)
*The period of time over which a single dose of the medication or vaccine should be administered.(en)
*For example: '200 ml/h'. Use the text data type to record non- or semi-quantifiable instructions.(en)
*The rate at which the medication, such as an infusion, is to be administered.(en)

*For example: '10mg/kg/day'. The result of this formula would normally be held in Dose amount/unit or Administration rate/duration. Where clinical measurements such as body weight is used in the dose calculation, a LINK attribute should used to specify which particular measurement has been used.(en)
*The formula used to calculate the dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor, such as body weight or surface area.(en)
*The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.(en)
*For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*The unit which is associated with the Dose amount.(en)

*For example: '1', '2', '3'. Where multiple dosages are expressed, the 'Pattern sequence' makes the order in which they should be executed explicit. For example: (1) 1 tab in the morning, (2) 2 tab at 2pm, (3) 1 tab at night.(en)
*The intended position of this dosage within the overall sequence of dosages.(en)

*For example, can be used to represent a unit-dose based value such as 'tabs', when the Dose amount is expressed as an SI unit such as 'mg', or where it is required to express the total amount of an infusion as well as the dose amount of the active ingredient.(en)
*An alternate representation of the value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.(en)
*The unit which is associated with the Alternate dose amount.(en)

*For example: "Apply ointment to affected area until it glistens". This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for increasing/tapering dosages without necessarily specifying the doses in a structured way.(en)
Dodatne informcije o stekleniki za mleno meanico pacienta
tevilka steklenike mlene meanice. Obiajno doloeno tevilo tevilk dodeljeneno posameznem oddelku.
Details of timing schedules repeating over periods longer than a single day.
The activity should take place on a specific date.
The interval between repetitions of the activity.
The activity should take place on a specific day of the week, with 0 representing Sunday.
e.g. 'on the 3rd, 13th and 23rd of each month'.
The activity should take place on a specific day of the month.
The name of the event that triggers the activity to take place.
The activity should take place in relation to a specific named event.
e.g. '3 days after onset of menstruation = menstrual onset + 3 days', '2 weeks prior to admission= admission -2 weeks'.
The period of time before or after the named event when the activity should take place. Negative durations can be used to signifify that the activity should be taken before a known event.
e.g. 'take 3 tablets daily for 1 week, omit a week, then take 3 tablets daily for 1 week, repeat 4 times'
A cycle of activity where an on-off pattern is required.
The period of time for which the activity should take place.
The period of time for which the activity should NOT take place.
The number of repetitions of the on/off cycle.
e.g. "3 times per week", "2-4 times per month".
The number of days per time period on which the activity is to take place.
The activity should only be performed on a single occasion and is not to be repeated.
*Details of timing schedules repeating over periods longer than a single day.(en)
*The activity should take place on a specific date.(en)
*The interval between repetitions of the activity.(en)
*The activity should take place on a specific day of the week, with 0 representing Sunday.(en)
*The activity should take place on a specific day of the month.(en)
*The name of the event that triggers the activity to take place.(en)
*The activity should take place in relation to a specific named event.(en)
*e.g. '3 days after onset of menstruation = menstrual onset + 3 days', '2 weeks prior to admission= admission -2 weeks'.(en)
*The period of time before or after the named event when the activity should take place. Negative durations can be used to signifify that the activity should be taken before a known event.(en)
*e.g. 'take 3 tablets daily for 1 week, omit a week, then take 3 tablets daily for 1 week, repeat 4 times'(en)
*A cycle of activity where an on-off pattern is required.(en)
*The period of time for which the activity should take place.(en)
*The period of time for which the activity should NOT take place.(en)
*The number of repetitions of the on/off cycle.(en)
*e.g. "3 times per week", "2-4 times per month".(en)
*The number of days per time period on which the activity is to take place.(en)
*The activity should only be performed on a single occasion and is not to be repeated.(en)
Overall summary of the medication course.
The overall status of this order.
The data at which the medication course was first ordered or recommended.
The date at which the medication was first issued. 'Issued' refers to the prescription 'token' electronic or paper which authorises supply of a medication.
The date at which the medication prescription was last issued. This refers to the prescription 'token' electronic or paper which authorises supply of a medication.

The date at which the medication was first authorised.For a repeat prescription, authorisation refers to the creation of the repeat prescription 'master' which is followed by the production of one or more prescription issues.

The data at which the medication was last authorised.The date at which the medication was first authorised.For a repeat prescription, authorisation refers to the creation of the repeat prescription 'master' which is followed by the production of one or more prescription issues. Authorisation is generally only given for a limited period or limited number of issues, after which re-authorisation is required.
The date at which the medicaton was first physically dispensed.
The date at which the medication was last dispensed.
The date at which the medication was first administered to the patient.
The date at which the medication was last administered.
The date at which the medication was discontinued.
The date at which the medication was authorised or re-authorised.
The date at which a medication prescription was issued i.e the physical or electronic prescription token was created.
The date at which a medication was dispensed.
The date at which a medication was administered.
The data at which administration of a medication was withheld or suspended.
The date at which the medication order was reviewed.
The date at which the medication order was last reviewed.
The date at which the medication instruction was modified.
This is a medication that has previously been issued, dispensed or administered but has now been discontinued.
A medication which was ordered or authorised but has been cancelled prior to being issued, dispensed or adiminstered.
The medication course has been completed.
This medication order has been superseded by another.
Actions reuulting from the order are to be temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called 'on-hold'.
The medication order has been made but further processes e.g. sign-off or verification are required before it becomes actionable.
Actions resulting from the order are to be temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called 'on-hold'.
Keep same diet after abstinece ends
*The data at which the medication course was first ordered or recommended.(en)
*The date at which the medication was first issued. 'Issued' refers to the prescription 'token' electronic or paper which authorises supply of a medication.(en)
*The date at which the medication prescription was last issued. This refers to the prescription 'token' electronic or paper which authorises supply of a medication.(en)

*The date at which the medication was first authorised.For a repeat prescription, authorisation refers to the creation of the repeat prescription 'master' which is followed by the production of one or more prescription issues.(en)

*The data at which the medication was last authorised.The date at which the medication was first authorised.For a repeat prescription, authorisation refers to the creation of the repeat prescription 'master' which is followed by the production of one or more prescription issues. Authorisation is generally only given for a limited period or limited number of issues, after which re-authorisation is required.(en)
*The date at which the medicaton was first physically dispensed.(en)
*The date at which the medication was last dispensed.(en)
*The date at which the medication was first administered to the patient.(en)
*The date at which the medication was last administered.(en)
*The date at which the medication was discontinued.(en)
*The date at which the medication was authorised or re-authorised.(en)
*The date at which a medication prescription was issued i.e the physical or electronic prescription token was created.(en)
*The date at which a medication was dispensed.(en)
*The date at which a medication was administered.(en)
*The data at which administration of a medication was withheld or suspended.(en)
*The date at which the medication order was reviewed.(en)
*The date at which the medication order was last reviewed.(en)
*The date at which the medication instruction was modified.(en)
Naroilo je zaustavljeno, ker pacient mora biti te
Naroilo je zaustavljeno, ker je pacient v karenci
Enaka dieta pacienta po preteku zaustavitve prehrane
Newborn has not yet been fed
Ali novorojenek e ni bil hranjen?
Details of use, administration, dispensing or other care step relating to a food which may arise from an instruction from a clinician.
The instruction has issued as an item on a prescription.
The nutrition has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time.
A single administration of the nutrition has taken place.
The nutrition course has been completed as planned.
The nutrition course has not been dispensed as supply is not yet available.
The administration of the nutrition has been suspended. No further doses should be given until further notice, or when the restart date or conditions have been met.
A prescription token has been re-issued for an existing nutrition order.
Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.
The planned administration has been cancelled prior to any administration.
A scheduled nutrition has been postponed prior to any administration.
The administration of this nutrition has been ceased before anticipated completion.
The time to start this nutrition, or other starting condition, has been set.

The administration of a nutrition has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.
The food which was the focus of the action. This element will normally be coded with a foods terminology but free text may be required in some cases.
The reason(s) the specific action or step was carried out. Note: This is not the reason for the nutrition instruction, rather the specific reason e.g. for administration.
A comment on the action taken including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.
The sequence number specific to the action being recorded.
Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or carer at the time of the action.
A dispensed nutrition is returned, or not collected, without being used.
A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.
The nutrition order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.
Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.
The datetime at which the nutrition order was scheduled to occur.
Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.
Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.
Details of the product dispensed, authorised or administered.
Assigned by the manufacturer to identify the manufacturing batch of the item.
The expiry date of the food administered as documented by the manufacturer.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
The identifier assigned with the original order.

Used in mental health to allow monitoring of total amount of a drug class andministered e.g. anti-psychotics, where each nutrition is associated with a percentage contribution towards a total daily maximum, normally 100%.
The proportion of the maximum allowed dose equivalent administered.
A repeat prescription or dispense has been re-authorised.
The nutrition has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.
The reason(s) why a particular dose administration did not take place, including complte omission of the dose and deferral of the dose.
The reason(s) for amending or stopping a course of nutrition.
The patient experienced an adverse reaction.
The clinical response to the nutrition was inadequate.
The course was changed because of patient preference or difficulty.
The nutrition was prescribed in error.
The nutrition was suspended for a temporary period only.
The dose form/strength and or route were changed.
The patient refused to take the nutrition.
The patient is on a nil-by-mouth regime.
The nutrition administration was withheld/deferred for a clinical reason.
Details of the amount of nutrition supplied i.e. authorised, dispensed or administered.
Subsitution action taken by the dispenser.
The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.
A suspended nutrition has had its restart date or condition set.
A nutrition was dispensed which is bioequivalent to that ordered.
Although allowed by the nutrition order a substitute bioequvalent nutrition was not dispensed.
Details of body site and delivery of the nutrition.
For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Identification of the site of administration of the nutrition, vaccine or therapeutic good.
Structured description of the site of administration of the nutrition, vaccine or therapeutic good.
The method by which the nutrition is to be delivered.
Details of the medical device used to assist delivery of the nutrition.
*Details of use, administration, dispensing or other care step relating to a food which may arise from an instruction from a clinician.(en)
*The instruction has issued as an item on a prescription.(en)
*The nutrition has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time.(en)
*A single administration of the nutrition has taken place.(en)
*The nutrition course has been completed as planned.(en)
*The nutrition course has not been dispensed as supply is not yet available.(en)
*The administration of the nutrition has been suspended.(en)
*A prescription token has been re-issued for an existing nutrition order.(en)
*Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.(en)
*The planned administration has been cancelled prior to any administration.(en)
*A scheduled nutrition has been postponed prior to any administration.(en)
*The administration of this nutrition has been ceased before anticipated completion.(en)
*The time to start this nutrition, or other starting condition, has been set.(en)

*The administration of a nutrition has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.(en)
Prehrana pacienta, ki jo naroamo. Ta element je ponavadi vezan na terminologijo, vendar je dovoljena uporaba tudi prostega teksta v primerih, ko je to potrebno.
*A comment on the action taken including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.(en)
*Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or carer at the time of the action.(en)
*A dispensed nutrition is returned, or not collected, without being used.(en)
*A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.(en)
*The nutrition order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)
* Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)
Planirana datum in ura za naroilo prehrane.
*Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)
*Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.(en)
*Details of the product dispensed, authorised or administered.(en)
*The identifier assigned with the original order. (en)
*The proportion of the maximum allowed dose administered.(en)
*A repeat prescription or dispense has been re-authorised.(en)
*The nutrition has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)
Razlog zakaj doloeni obrok ni bil konzumiran.
Klinini odziv pacienta na prehrano ni bil primeren
Prehrana je bila spremenjena glede na pacientovo eljo oz. teavo
Pacient je na reimu hranjenja, ki ne gre skozi usta
*Details of the amount of nutrition supplied i.e. authorised, dispensed or administered.(en)
*The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.(en)
*A suspended nutrition has had its restart date or condition set.(en)
*A nutrition was dispensed which is bioequivalent to that ordered.(en)
*Although allowed by the nutrition order a substitute bioequvalent nutrition was not dispensed.(en)
*Details of body site and delivery of the nutrition.(en)
*For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Identification of the site of administration of the nutrition, vaccine or therapeutic good.(en)
*Structured description of the site of administration of the nutrition, vaccine or therapeutic good.(en)
*The method by which the nutrition is to be delivered.(en)
*Details of the medical device used to assist delivery of the nutrition.(en)
Koliina obroka, ki ga je pacient zauil
Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.

The period of care to which this composition belongs. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.
The identifier of the departmental period of care to which this Composition belongs.
Portlet ID from which stores the information where was the composition saved.

ID asa zdravljenja, ki mu pripada ta composition. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.(en)
ID asa zdravljenja na oddelku, ki mu pripada ta composition.
ID portleta v katerem so shranjene informacije o shranjenom composition-u.
